playing that character, which I can understand, considering that his 
personality was very fun-loving and childlike. No one could have done a 
better performance.

comments.text:
Rip king of the pop xxx You were, not only a talented actor, singer and 
dancer but you were one of the kindest and most charitable people on earth. 
It is so unfair what happened to you before you had to leave us. The 
hologram doesn't to the king justice, I was born in 2000 so I missed your 
glory days and my mum called you a freak but she was so wrong. You inspired 
me as you inspire many and, Michael, we miss you so much. I wish I could 
have been around to be one of the many who supported you from the beginning 
but I hope that you go down in history as one of the Greats. Rip dear king!﻿

comments.author: FunkyFresh Diva

comments.text:
I was just on this bridge this afternoon! It is in Queens at the Corona 
Flushing Meadows Park 1964 World's Fair. This is just yards from the 
Pavillion Theater Tent (long closed and going through restoration) which 
was the set of MunchkinLand.  This bridge is called the Ampitheatre Bridge 
and goes over the Long Island Expressway going toward Meadow Lake. The 
multi-layer shots of the Chrysler Building, Wall and ThunderBolt 
Rollercoaster were superimposed, of course. When you are there, you get the 
sense that you've seen this view before.﻿

comments.author: margolou2010

comments.text:
Interesting trivia: Diana was not the first choice for this role.  I read 
where she begged and begged and the casting crew finally gave in since she 
had friends in high places.  Also, the script for this movie that is 
believe to have been used by Richard Pryor was found in an old abandoned 
Hollywood storage unit and sold on eBay a few years back.  ﻿
comments.author: AutopsyReport22

though this was MJ's first real acting job.
